channel.title: What revision should I use for a base, and why?
channel.description:
What revision should I start off in? I had a version of Project Perfection, but it's a horribly coded mess. I don't want to use it anymore...
No more 317's loading high 602/508 graphics for me. >.>
So should I go with older stuff or newer? Any suggestions??

item.title: What revision should I use for a base, and why?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“kleber883, post:23, topic:458038”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=560961.msg4094089#msg4094089 date=1346685963]
Kleber, the commands are all in Client.java – basically everything is in Client.java lol.
[/quote]

Thank you, Fridder. I appreciate it. That actually makes more sense than having a whole bunch of separate .java files…

Wait till I finish developing my 317 client base :P, also I’d use Utopia (delta) as a base.

Hmm. I’m curious as to the client base, and I will never touch Delta. Ever. :P[/quote]
Lol. Allstar’s worse than Delta…

the elve age:

Wait till I finish developing my 317 client base :P, also I’d use Utopia (delta) as a base.

project Zeta > Utopia

Read full topic
item.source: What revision should I use for a base, and why?

item.title: What revision should I use for a base, and why?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“kleber883, post:37, topic:458038”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=560961.msg4094638#msg4094638 date=1346714076]

No one will join a PI or Delta anymore. and as for Silab… well… it speaks for itself…

That’s because nobody actually puts effort into a P.I. or Delta!

EDIT: Except for my Belgian friend. You know who you are.

Well. I put effort into the current PI I have, but no one joined, and I think the newer revisions are ugly.

You didn’t put effort in it
[/quote]

Meh. I spent at least 80-120 hours in it, but I guess that’s not much in comparison to some…[/quote]
multiply that by 15 and you are close to my hours, still working on it

Read full topic

item.title: What revision should I use for a base, and why?
item.dc:creator: @Dark_Wing Dark Wing
item.description:
@Dark_Wing wrote:

[quote=“kleber883, post:29, topic:458038”][quote author=Dark Wing link=topic=560961.msg4094611#msg4094611 date=1346713095]
It doesn’t matter if the server has crappy customs like you said earlier in the thread. If your using a source to learn, then you should LEARN to delete them. I started with delta by the way. I loved it , I was so happy when I started writing my own material without tutorials. It started out slow like writing my own simple teleport commands. Then it got into other slightly bigger stuff. I always loved delta right now I can right customs skills/mini games. It’s so rewarding
I would choose delta
[/quote]

No Delta, Silab or PI. Too many already made. And no new stuff if I can help it. :)[/quote]
You are trying to Learn? Why does it matter?

Read full topic

item.title: What revision should I use for a base, and why?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“kleber883, post:25, topic:458038”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=560961.msg4094118#msg4094118 date=1346687148]

basically everything is in Client.java lol.

That actually makes more sense than having a whole bunch of separate .java files…


[/quote]

?? …I said something wrong?

Edify me?[/quote]

That actually makes more sense than having a whole bunch of separate .java files....

No. It doesn’t. Logically if a server was designed correctly, the classes would be packaged and distributed logically through out. Packing all the methods and classes into one file is messy.

item.title: What revision should I use for a base, and why?
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

I think when push comes to shove a Non clean delta with 317 client will be a good start. Will help you learn simpler problems to fix, how to remove pointless systems (out of date update servers, custom curses), and cover the basics of quests construction, use of timers, interface construction, and many, many more things. So go forth and fine the crappiest looking 317 filled with half coded customs and invalid teleports.

Ya know…I think I’ll do just that. Thanks!

Read full topic
item.source: What revision should I use for a base, and why?

item.title: What revision should I use for a base, and why?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

I think when push comes to shove a Non clean delta with 317 client will be a good start. Will help you learn simpler problems to fix, how to remove pointless systems (out of date update servers, custom curses), and cover the basics of quests construction, use of timers, interface construction, and many, many more things. So go forth and fine the crappiest looking 317 filled with half coded customs and invalid teleports.

Read full topic
item.source: What revision should I use for a base, and why?

item.title: What revision should I use for a base, and why?
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

Okay.

AllStar: My take on this…

…There’s a delay between clicking and movement, I’ll need to find and change that.
The interfaces are okay…

I don’t like autotalking NPCs. They must go.

If I started it exactly as I found it, the economy would be shit; gotta change prices and stuff.

Makes me feel like a noob… I don’t know where anything is located… i.e. the commands.java that was in PI. I suppose it’s integrated with another file now… Sigh…

Project Insanity’s layout is very…organized and easy to follow. This is different.

Overall: Someone put a lot of time into this, but it’s so ugly right now, and I really need to change that. Other then that, it’s pretty great. Let’s see how far I get on this. Wish me luck! .-.

Read full topic
item.source: What revision should I use for a base, and why?
